abstract: Former Navy SEAL Matt Bissonnette agrees to relinquish $6.8 million in book royalties and other profits from his best-selling book No Easy Day and apologizes for failing to adhere to Pentagon disclosure requirements regarding release of classified information; book, written under pen name Mark Owen, documents raid that resulted in death of Osama Bin Laden.

keywords.value: No Easy Day: The Firsthand Account of the Mission That Killed Osama bin Laden (Book)
keywords.name: creative_works

lead_paragraph: The payment comes as part of a settlement with the Justice Department for failing to have his book vetted for military secrets.
snippet: The payment comes as part of a settlement with the Justice Department for failing to have his book vetted for military secrets....

headline.main: Ex-SEAL Member Who Wrote Book on Bin Laden Raid Forfeits $6.8 Million
headline.print_headline: Bin Laden Raid Writer Forfeits $6.8 Million
